item.title: Two new children's books capture the sights, sounds and community-building of Ramadan
item.description: As millions of Muslims begin observing Ramadan, NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks to Aya Khalil and Nadine Presley, authors of two new children's books about this holy month.
item.content:encoded: As millions of Muslims begin observing Ramadan, NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks to Aya Khalil and Nadine Presley, authors of two new children's books about this holy month.

item.title: Greetings from Cairo, where lights and decorations transform the city during Ramadan
item.description: As Ramadan begins, traditional lanterns called fawanees brighten Cairo. They have become a symbol of Ramadan and are an almost-mandatory home decoration for the holy month in Egypt.
item.content:encoded: As Ramadan begins, traditional lanterns called fawanees brighten Cairo. They have become a symbol of Ramadan and are an almost-mandatory home decoration for the holy month in Egypt.
item.dc:creator: Greg Dixon

item.title: Lunar New Year, Ramadan and Lent converge this week
item.description: This week marks the beginning of the Lunar New Year, Ramadan and Lent. The three holidays are governed by different lunar calendars, and it's extremely rare for them to coincide.
item.content:encoded: This week marks the beginning of the Lunar New Year, Ramadan and Lent. The three holidays are governed by different lunar calendars, and it's extremely rare for them to coincide.

item.title: Ramadan in Cairo blends the old and the new
item.description: The world's Muslims are preparing for the holy month of Ramadan, a time of fasting and prayer. In Cairo, that means shopping for gifts and buying decorations to get into the spirit of the holy month.

item.title: These monks' walk for peace captivated Americans. It ends this week
item.description: A group of Buddhist monks walked from Fort Worth, Texas, to Washington, D.C., in the name of peace. The 108-day pilgrimage captivated Americans.

item.title: For Jews in Minnesota, the festival of Tu Bishvat takes on a new meaning this year
item.description: Rabbis in Minneapolis reflect on the agricultural holiday of Tu Bishvat and what it means for the city after the killings by ICE agents.

item.title: 'Ye Gods' asks guests where their moral compass comes from
item.description: What does it mean to have faith, and where do our moral codes come from? Scott Carter of 'Ye Gods' podcast tries to tackle these big questions.

item.title: Church protest leads to debate among Christians about the morality of working for ICE
item.description: Protesters recently interrupted service at a Twin Cities church because one of the pastors works for ICE. That's led some Christians to debate whether working for ICE aligns with their values.

item.title: Maine immigrants protected by "God squad"
item.description: Faith leaders in Maine are trying to protect immigrants from being taken into ICE custody. The so-called "God squad" forms a human barrier to protect employees arriving to work at a local factory.
